p: Until now, there has been little research on the relevant factors associated with health anxiety according to cognitive-behavioral models and previous research (e.g., cyberchondria) in the context of virus outbreaks. In particular, there are hardly any studies on the current COVID-19 pandemic. For example, it was assumed that people with pre-existing health anxiety or hypochondriasis would be particularly vulnerable to anxiety and adverse behaviors during pandemics such as COVID-19, but there is little empirical research on this ( Asmundson & Taylor, 2020).
